name: Ahmad Al-Qattu
title: Introduction
content: I’m a software developer who transforms ideas into practical, dependable applications. Working across the full stack, I create stable and efficient solutions—whether building web platforms, mobile products, or integrated backend services. My aim is always to deliver software that people find useful, accessible, and easy to trust.

data.subtitle: Software Engineer
data.highlight: Transforming Ideas into Modern, Scalable Solutions

title: What Can I Do?
content: Over the years, I've gained experience across multiple domains, from front-end UI development to back-end services and databases.

title: Skills
content: Over the years, I've gained experience across multiple domains, from front-end UI development to back-end services and databases.

title: Projects
content: Here are some of the projects I have worked on. They include web apps, mobile apps, and various Desktop Apps, Scripts

projects.name: Twitter Clone
projects.description: A microblogging platform clone with user auth and tweeting
projects.fullDescription: Developed a Twitter clone using Javalin, Pebble template, HTMX, Bootstrap, and PostgreSQL. Features include user authentication, tweeting, retweeting, and following. Containerized with Docker, implemented unit tests and integration tests using Selenide. Provides a responsive UI and robust backend.

projects.name: رﺣﻠﺗﻲ
projects.description: A microblogging platform clone with user auth and tweeting
projects.fullDescription: 'رﺣﻠﺗﻲ' – mobile app for Local Tours and Booking Implemented features for tour booking, itinerary planning, and user profile for suggestions, admin panel, group for messages for every tour. using Flutter and firebase firestore, add foreign Api to get weather.

projects.name: eMunicipality
projects.description: A microblogging platform clone with user auth and tweeting
projects.fullDescription: Participated in the development of an eMunicipalities API using .NET Core, leveraging Entity Framework for database operations, implementing JWT authentication for secure access, and integrating legacy .NET SOAP services via WCF. On the front end, Participated in the development a Progressive Web App (PWA) with React and Material-UI, thin deploying the application to the store for accessible user experience.

projects.name: Land Settlement Archiving
projects.description: Land Settlement Archiving Developed a Python algorithm to process Excel files for the Land Authority’s archiving initiative, focusing on data cleaning and extraction. created JavaFX desktop apps for PDF auditing, merging, and other utilities. thes app is example of the desktop app for auditing PDF scand files.

projects.name: web-project-php-sql
projects.description: A microblogging platform clone with user auth and tweeting
projects.fullDescription: This university-level web application demonstrates fundamental CRUD operations through its task management interface. Users can create new tasks, view existing tasks in real time, update task details, and delete them when no longer needed—all powered by a SQL-driven database and a PHP back end. This seamless interaction is further enhanced by role-based access controls and client-side scripting, ensuring a secure, user-friendly environment for managing and tracking tasks.

projects.name: AI-3-gram_word_prediction
projects.description: A microblogging platform clone with user auth and tweeting
projects.fullDescription: AI 3-gram word prediction, built with Java and JavaFX, showcases an Arabic text prediction system utilizing a 3-gram language model. Through an intuitive graphical interface, users can input partial text and receive likely completions, with probabilities displayed in real time. This combination of Java’s robust backend and JavaFX’s sleek UI design.

projects.name: dijkstra algorithm routing
projects.description: A microblogging platform clone with user auth and tweeting
projects.fullDescription: This network routing interface demonstrates how Dijkstra’s algorithm can be employed to find the shortest path between nodes in a graph. By generating a randomized set of points (nodes) and allowing users to select a source and target, the tool computes and displays the minimal path cost in real time. This visual, JavaFX‐based application highlights both the algorithm’s step‐by‐step evaluation of path weights and the interactive nature of modern graph‐based routing solutions.

projects.name: library DBMS
projects.description: A microblogging platform clone with user auth and tweeting
projects.fullDescription: This library management system, implemented with MySQL, Java, and JavaFX, handles essential CRUD operations for employees, members, publishers, and books, as well as borrowing/returning transactions and invoicing. it employs real‐time statistics and a streamlined UI in JavaFX.

projects.name: Ramallah A-star algorithm
projects.description: A microblogging platform clone with user auth and tweeting
projects.fullDescription: This Ramallah A* map application showcases how the A* pathfinding algorithm can be applied to real‐world geography. By selecting a source and target from an interactive JavaFX interface, users can compute the shortest route and view relevant details such as path distance, travel time, and memory usage. This demonstration highlights the efficiency of heuristic‐driven search for routing in complex, map‐based environments.

educationList.details: Specialized in full-stack development with projects in web services and mobile applications.
